Key Arguments: The legislation would undermine democratic freedoms by giving ACMA excessive power.
It would allow the government to label dissenting opinions as misinformation or disinformation.
The legislation could punish individuals and platforms with heavy fines for sharing opinions.
The proposal is seen as hypocritical and undemocratic, applying only to the public and not to government officials.
Notable Quotes: This proposed legislation ‘New ACMA powers to combat misinformation and disinformation’ would strip away the very ‘democratic’ freedoms it purports to protect.

The notion that up to a $500’000 fine could be leveled at any public social media or other public communications platform that carries an Australian Mum or Dad’s opinion smacks of Communist style totalitarianism.
I whole heartedly oppose this legislation that muzzles Australian free speech, and say “Yeah, Naw, mate”, put this proposed legislation in the rubbish bin where it belongs.
